articles.title: Rural Youth Activists Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Rural Youth Activists Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The participants in the National Meeting of Activists of Rural Youth Workteams and Youth Subworkteams visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday.
					 The participants paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues.
					
					 At the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state, the participants made deep bows to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the great leaders received are on display and halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their revolutionary life.

articles.title: Japan Blasted for Evading Responsibility for Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
Japan Blasted for Evading Responsibility for Sexual Slavery
Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- It was reported that the co-representative of the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea condemned Japan for evading the responsibility for the past sexual slavery at the Asian solidarity meeting for the solution of the issue of the sexual slavery for the imperial Japanese army held in Seoul on Mar. 8.
					 The co-representative said that there were more testimonies of victims of the sexual slavery in not only the Korean Peninsula but also the rest of the world including Asia.
					
					 The victims of the sexual slavery from various countries and regions attending the meeting also testified that they had been forcibly taken into sexual slavery by the Japanese imperialist beasts, and demanded that the Japanese government admit the past crimes and make an apology and reparation for them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Algeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Algeria
Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The Tarzalt Publishing House in El-Djezair of Algeria brought out in booklet leader Kim Jong Il's work "Abuses of Socialism Are Intolerable".
					 The work, published on March 1, Juche 82 (1993), deals with the reactionary nature and falsity of the sophistry of the imperialists and the renegades of socialism calling socialism "totalitarian", "barracks-like" and "administrative and commanding".
					
					 It also elucidates the principled issues arising in defending and accomplishing the socialist cause, including the issue of making the people have an unshakable faith in socialism and regard it as their moral duty to defend it and the issue of giving full play to the advantages of socialism.
					
					 A ceremony of releasing the work took place at the publishing house on March 1.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Marked by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Marked by Foreign Media
Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Foreign media featured reports on leader Kim Jong Il in celebration of his birth anniversary (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Foreign papers were illustrated with the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il and his photos.
					
					 The Thai paper Xing San Daily said that the Workers' Party of Korea developed into the ever-victorious guiding force, the Korean People's Army into an invincible revolutionary army and the DPRK into an impregnable socialist fortress under his leadership, referring to his feats in detail.
					
					 The Indian paper Indian and World Event dedicated three whole pages to an article praising his revolutionary career.
					
					 The German paper Rote Fahne and an Egyptian paper             said that he built the Workers' Party of Korea into the party across which the system of the leader's idea and leadership was firmly established, into the mother party which formed a harmonious whole with the popular masses and serves them and into the experienced and seasoned political general staff steering the Songun cause.
					
					 The AKP, State Radio, Apsara Radio, F.M. 90.5 Radio of Cambodia and the Belarusian paper Samostoyatelnosti, the Guinean paper Horoya, etc. reported that the flower of the sun Kimjongilia is in full bloom in many countries.
					
					 A Guinean state TV broadcasting and DR Congo TV broadcasting aired Korean films "Prosperous Pyongyang" and "The Flag of the Workers' Party of Korea".

articles.title: Korean Book, Photo, Fine Art Exhibitions Held in Different Countries
articles.content:
Korean Book, Photo, Fine Art Exhibitions Held in Different Countries
Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Korean book, photo and fine art exhibitions were held in India, China, Venezuela, Nigeria and Uganda to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed at the venues were photos showing the revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 There were also works of the peerlessly great men, and books, photos and art pieces dealing with the reality of the DPRK and appearance of its people.
					
					 Personages of various strata of the relevant countries, who went round the exhibitions, admired the struggle of the Korean people who are creating miracles and innovations in building a powerful socialist country under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea, demonstrating the country's dignity and prestige.
					
					 Personages of India noted that they came to have a fresher understanding of the DPRK, the world progressives loving justice and peace are admiring the Korean people who are dynamically advancing along the road of independence and that the reality of the DPRK is the brilliant fruition of the wise leadership of the outstanding leaders.
					
					 Personages of the political and public circles of Nigeria and Uganda emphasized that the noble image of Kim Jong Il is kept forever in the hearts of the progressives as well as the Korean people, praising him as a genuine people's leader and an outstanding elder statesman who made an immortal contribution to accomplishing the global independence.

articles.title: Activistas de brigadas y cuadrillas juveniles agricolas visitan Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
articles.content:
Activistas de brigadas y cuadrillas juveniles agricolas visitan Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
Pyongyang, 11 de marzo (ACNC) -- Los participantes en la reunion nacional de activistas de brigadas y cuadrillas juveniles del campo visitaron hoy el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan. 
					Los visitantes rindieron el sublime homenaje a los grandes Lideres Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il ante sus estatuas de pie y en los salones de eternidad donde estan conservados sus cuerpos. 
					
					Luego, pasaron revista a las salas de conservacion de las ordenes otorgadas a los lideres antecesores, y las otras de autos, carro electrico, barco y vagones de tren usados por ellos hasta el ultimo periodo de sus vidas para las visitas de orientacion sobre el terreno y viajes al extranjero.
